item.title: Amy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "We need, in love, to practice only this: letting each other go. For holding on comes easily; we do not need to learn it." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Amy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The point of marriage is not to create a quick commonality by tearing down all boundaries; on the contrary, a good marriage is one in which each partner appoints the other to be the guardian of his solitude, and thus they show each other the greatest possible trust. A merging of two people is an impossibility, and where it seems to exist, it is a hemming-in, a mutual consent that robs one party or both parties of their fullest freedom and development. But once the realization is accepted that even between the closest people infinite distances exist, a marvelous living side-by-side can grow up for them, if they succeed in loving the expanse between them, which gives them the possibility of always seeing each other as a whole and before an immense sky." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Amy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "And now we welcome the new year, full of things that have never been" -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Amy add a quote by Rilke
item.description: "you are not too old and it is not too late to dive into your increasing depths where life calmly gives out it's own secret" -- Rilke

item.title: Amy add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "To live is so startling it leaves little time for anything else." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Amy add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Forever is composed of nows." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Amy add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "This is my letter to the world That never wrote to me" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Amy add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Saying nothing sometimes says the most." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Amy add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "I love you not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you" -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Amy add a quote by Christopher Marlowe
item.description: "Come live with me and be my Love, And we will all the pleasures prove" -- Christopher Marlowe

item.title: Amy add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it." -- Rumi

item.title: Amy add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Let the beauty we love be what we do. There are hundreds of ways to kneel and kiss the ground." -- Rumi

item.title: Amy add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Don’t grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form." -- Rumi

item.title: Amy add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "The wound is the place where the Light enters you." -- Rumi

item.title: Amy add a quote by Siddhārtha Gautama
item.description: "You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection" -- Siddhārtha Gautama

item.title: Amy add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?" -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Amy add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "In the end these things matter most: How well did you love? How fully did you live? How deeply did you let go?" -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Amy add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "You only lose what you cling to." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Amy add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "Believe nothing, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Amy add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "If we fail to look after others when they need help, who will look after us?" -- Buddha

item.title: Amy add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned." -- Buddha

item.title: Amy add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "Every morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most." -- Buddha

item.title: Amy add a quote by Siddhārtha Gautama
item.description: "Whatever a monk keeps pursuing with his thinking and pondering, that becomes the inclination of his awareness." -- Siddhārtha Gautama

item.title: Amy add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "If you truly loved yourself, you could never hurt another." -- Buddha

item.title: Amy add a quote by Gautama Buddha
item.description:
"Now, Kalamas, don’t go by reports, by legends, by traditions, by scripture, by logical conjecture, by inference, by analogies, by agreement through pondering views, by probability, or by the thought, ‘This contemplative is our teacher.’ When you know for yourselves that, ‘These qualities are skillful; these qualities are blameless; these qualities are praised by the wise; these qualities, when adopted & carried out, lead to welfare & to happiness’ — then you should enter & remain in them.
[<i>Kalama Sutta, AN 3.65</i>]" -- Gautama Buddha
